result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas A Bohlmann

records.addlTxt:
11:06 AM Defendant Nicholas A Bohlmann in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Nicholas A Bohlmann.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Court conducts a plea colloquy with defendant. 
State moves to dismiss and read into cases 22CM351 and 22CM449
Defense does not object. 
Court dismisses and reads into cases 22CM351 and 22CM449.

Any monies posted on bond to be refunded to poster.

11:01 AM Defendant Nicholas A Bohlmann in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis as friend of the court for Nicholas A Bohlmann.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
State has a global offer in this matter and looking further it could be read two different ways. 
State reports victims are not present today. 
Atty Griffis does request a new date to clarify offer and have victims appear in person.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

11:37 AM Defendant Nicholas A Bohlmann in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Griffis makes a statement to the court. 
Global offer on all matters. 
Court will set for a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10:25 AM Defendant Nicholas A Bohlmann in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Griffis makes a statement to the court and his client has just received new charges and Atty Griffis requests 90 days. 
State has nothing to add. 
Court will set a status.  Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr on June 15, 2022

COURT ORDERED A $250.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $500.00 SIGNATURE BOND.  APPLY CASH BAIL PREVIOUSLY POSTED.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with Witness A/Zachary F./Ryan Y./Pewaukee Golf Club listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

02:36 PM Defendant Nicholas A Bohlmann in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
